basic.floral_language:
Echeveria 'Hakuhou' 
Floriography: broad, brave, independent
Echeveria 'Hakuhou' is a relatively large Echeveria, with thick leaves in blue-green like spoons covered with a thick layer of white powder, leaves are closely arranged in a rosette, like a blooming lotus. When in a cool season with adequate light, leaf edges turn red.
Likes sunny places, no apparent dormancy. Flowers sometimes with orange flowers.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, orange red flowers
basic.color: Leaf color green, with strong light leaf turn to red

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Like sunshine, no apparent period of dormancy
maintenance.watering: Do not water frequently, keep a dry environment, water every 7-10 days
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once every month
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
